result.execSummary:
The defendant Solomon M. Limon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to FTE/school or combination of both if able and if not, 10 hours community service per week-at agent's discretion.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
CORRECTED- SAFE Program
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
2 credit if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment,schooling, or a combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week and if not, then perform 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization.

SAFE program.
Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
